Melchana arrived with the Hellgate in Northern France. She landed the 
ship and came out.

Melchana: Daemos said the vines should be here somewhere... now 
where... oh... I see...

On her left, a massive techno-organic vineyard stood. The fruits it 
bore were ripe, full of energon and ready to be harvested. Melchana 
took out a large cargo hold from the ship. She started cutting the 
energon fruits with her arm blades. In a few mega-cycles she COULD be 
over...

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Daemos: Now Belthassan, I have to tell you about the harvesting 
mission. First though, you must assure me you will tell no one.

Belthassan: I agree, but it is not without an afterthought.

Daemos: That is fine for me. We are to bring back the energon to 
Raiko-fhi 8 for weaponry loading.

Belthassan: Raiko-fhi 8? You mean the institute? Why is that?

Daemos: I am sorry, friend... It seems our lords have had more trust 
in me than in you... It is wasteful, I think... That is why they told 
me the great lines of the plan. You have heard of the prototype Matrix 
weapons, did you not?

Belthassan thought for a moment. Matrix weaponry? It did sound 
familiar but... No... There was no way. He dropped his jaw in awe.

Belthassan: Why was I never told? What uses will this have?

Daemos: Do not worry. It will be reserved for the Homeworlds for now. 
I doubt we will have access to these soon.

Belthassan: But the Matrix is not a toy, and even less a weapon! You 
know it as much as I do! Why would they even consider this?

Daemos hardened himself.

Daemos: Behave, captain! These answers are not mine to give, and we 
are not in any position to discuss orders! Deal with what you have!

For the first time on this planet, Belthassan transformed into a big 
polar bear and went wordlessly to the Matrix chamber, angry at the 
few things he just learned.
